SOLUTIONS.TITLE: How do I cancel PayPal/Website Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal 1.5/3.0?
SOLUTIONS.TEMPLATE:
Here is how to cancel PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal:

  1. Log in to your PayPal account.
  2. Click Profile.
  3. Click My money. (Don't see this step? Follow the instructions below.)
  4. Locate More Financial Settings.
  5. Click Monthly account billing.
  6. Click Cancel Billing button on the bottom of the page.

If you cancel PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal, you won’t be able to use certain account features. For example, you won’t be able to:

  • Process credit cards directly on your website with Direct Payment API.
  • Automatically deny payments that you think may be risky with Advanced Fraud Management Filters.

To reaccept the PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal Billing Agreement and follow the steps above. If you canceled the Pro/Virtual Terminal billing agreement yourself, you will see an option to re-accept it. If PayPal canceled the billing agreement for you, we will need to re-enable it for you.

If you follow the steps above and do not see the Cancel Billing option, please contact us via email at vt@paypal.com or by phone at 1-888-221-1161 and authorize us to cancel your Pro/Virtual Terminal billing agreement.
SOLUTIONS.INTERNAL_NOTES:
Canceling Pro/VT does not cancel reserves. Please escalate to Merchant Risk Operations via PET2, MRO - Reserve Reconsiderations (MRM for Account Managed accounts) if eligibility requirements have been met for a reconsideration/removal of reserves.

Teammates can deactivate Pro/VT 1.5/3.0:

  1. Find the account in ADMIN.
  2. Go to the Products Info page.
  3. Click on the blue hyperlink 'Preapproved Payments' on the right hand side.
  4. Locate the billing agreement with "PayPal Monthly Billing."
  5. Click Cancel and confirm.

If an agent cancels Pro/VT for a customer, the user will be unable to reactivate their billing agreement online and must contact PayPal again.

If a customer has a 1.5 account, they will not see the agreement in the profile area as described above, so teammates will need to cancel the agreement for them.
SOLUTIONS.NEW_BUSINESS:
Here is how to cancel PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal:

  1. Log in to your PayPal account.
  2. Click Profile.
  3. Click My money. (Don't see this step? Follow the instructions below.)
  4. Locate More Financial Settings.
  5. Click Monthly account billing.
  6. Click Cancel Billing button on the bottom of the page.

If you cancel PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal, you won’t be able to use certain account features. For example, you won’t be able to:

  • Process credit cards directly on your website with Direct Payment API.
  • Automatically deny payments that you think may be risky with Advanced Fraud Management Filters.

To reaccept the PayPal Payments Pro or Virtual Terminal Billing Agreement and follow the steps above. If you canceled the Pro/Virtual Terminal billing agreement yourself, you will see an option to re-accept it. If PayPal canceled the billing agreement for you, we will need to re-enable it for you.

If you follow the steps above and do not see the Cancel Billing option, please contact us via email at vt@paypal.com or by phone at 1-888-221-1161 and authorize us to cancel your Pro/Virtual Terminal billing agreement.
